tool_description: The backbone of any Crypto or Blockchain project.
title: Crypto Market Data APIs

api_list.name: Get Specific Rate
api_list.description: Get exchange rates between pair of requested assets pointing at a specific or current time.

api_list.name: Latest Data
api_list.description: Get latest trades from all symbols up to 1 hour ago. Latest data is always returned in time descending order.

api_list.name: Latest Data by base asset
api_list.description: Get latest trades from a specific base asset up to 1 hour ago. Latest data is always returned in time descending order.

api_list.name: Latest Data by exchange assets pair
api_list.description: Get latest trades from a specific assets pair (exp. BTC / USD) in a specific exchange up to 1 hour ago. Latest data is always returned in time descending order.

api_list.name: Historical Data
api_list.description: Get history transactions from specific symbol, returned in time ascending order. If no start & end time is defined when calling the endpoint, your data results will be provided 24 hours back, by default.

api_list.name: Historical Data by exchange
api_list.description: Get history transactions from specific exchange, returned in time ascending order. If no start & end time is defined when calling the endpoint, your data results will be provided 24 hours back, by default.

api_list.name: Historical Data by asset pair
api_list.description: Get history transactions from specific assets pair (exp. BTC/USD), returned in time ascending order. If no start & end time is defined when calling the endpoint, your data results will be provided 24 hours back, by default.

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet Chain Endpoint
api_list.description: General information about a blockchain is available by GET-ing the base resource

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet Block Height Endpoint
api_list.description: Block Height endpoint gives you detail information for particular block in the blockchain

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet Latest Block Endpoint
api_list.description: Latest Block Endpoint gives you detail information for the latest block in the blockchain

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet Address Endpoint
api_list.description: The default Address Endpoint strikes a general information about addresses.

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet Multisig Address Endpoint
api_list.description: The Multisig Address Endpoint strikes a general information about a single address that is involved in multisignature addresses.

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet Generate Address Endpoint
api_list.description: The Generate Address endpoint allows you to generate private-public key-pairs along with an associated public address. No information is required with this POST request.

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet Address Transactions Endpoint
api_list.description: The Address Transactions Endpoint returns all information available about a particular address, including an array of complete transactions.

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet Get Wallet Endpoint
api_list.description: This endpoint returns a Wallet or HDWallet based on its WALLET_NAME.

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet Wallet Generate Addresses
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to generate a new address associated with the WALLET_NAME wallet, similar to the Generate Address Endpoint. If successful, it will returned the newly modified Wallet.

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet Wallet Create XPub Endpoint
api_list.description: Create XPub Endpoint allows you to create a random extended public key (based on your password), xpriv and wif.

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet Wallet Get XPub Change Addresses Endpoint
api_list.description: Get XPub Change Addresses Endpoint allows you to get the change(KeyPurpose: Change) addresses associated with the specified xpub. Since those are hierarchically ordered we provide the arguments from and to - both integeres, in order to be able to get the addresses in the specific positions. If you request, e.g. "from": 0 and "to": 50, this will return the first 50 change addresses linked to the specified xpub.

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet Wallet Get XPub Receive Addresses Endpoint
api_list.description: Get XPub receive Addresses Endpoint allows you to get the receive(KeyPurpose: RECEIVE_FUNDS) addresses associated with the specified xpub. Since those are hierarchically ordered we provide the arguments from and to - both integeres, in order to be able to get the addresses in the specific positions. If you request, e.g. "from": 0 and "to": 50, this will return the first 50 receive addresses linked to the specified xpub.

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet Wallet Delete
api_list.description: This endpoint deletes the Wallet or HD Wallet with WALLET_NAME. If successful, it will return an error message with no return object.

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet Create HD Wallet Endpoint
api_list.description: For HD wallets, at minimum, you must include WALLET_NAME, the ADDRESS_COUNT and the PASSWORD attributes.

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet List Wallets HD Endpoint
api_list.description: This endpoint returns a string array ($NAMEARRAY) of active wallet names (both normal ор HD) under the token you queried. You can then query detailed information on individual wallets (via their names) by leveraging the Get Wallet Endpoint.  Get Wallet Endpoint

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet Get HD wallet endpoint
api_list.description: This endpoint returns a WHDWallet based on its WALLET_NAME.

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet HD Wallet Delete
api_list.description: This endpoint deletes the HD Wallet with WALLET_NAME. If successful, it will return an error message with no return object.

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet Transaction Index by Block Hash Endpoint
api_list.description: The Transaction Index by Block Endpoint returns detailed information about a list of transactions. The endpoint is useable both with block height and block hash. index and limit query parameters might also be used, as their default values are, as follows: 0, 1. Therefore, if none is specified the returned object will be the first transaction (the coinbase transaction) included in the block.

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet Unconfirmed Transactions List Endpoint
api_list.description: The Unconfirmed Transactions Endpoint returns an array of the latest transactions relayed by nodes in a blockchain that haven’t been included in any blocks.

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet Create Transaction Endpoint
api_list.description: To use Crypto APIs two-endpoint transaction creation tool, first you need to provide the input address(es), output address, and value to transfer (in bitcoin). Provide this in a partially-filled out TX request object.

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet New Transaction Using HDWallet Endpoint
api_list.description: New Transaction Using HDWallet Endpoint provides the possibility to create, sign and send new transactions using your HDWallet. The mandatory fields are: walletName, password, outputs and fee (see example). There are a few optional fields, such as: inputs, fee address and locktime. If input addresses are not included, then the system will automatically choose addresses from the wallet. However, if included, a list of addresses from the wallet and the values should be specified. Fee address is optional and if is specified the fee will be proportionally distributed among the input addresses. Locktime is an integer and has a default value of zero. Use locktime if a transaction should be delayed to a specific time.

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet Webhook Delete
api_list.description: You can delete a WebHook by WEBHOOK_ID using this resource.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Address Info Endpoint
api_list.description: The default Address Endpoint strikes a balance between speed of response and data on Addresses. It returns information about the balance (in ETH) and transactions of a specified address.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Transaction by Address Endpoint
api_list.description: The Transactions By Address Endpoint returns all transactions specified by the query params: index and limit; The maxim value of limit is 50. The value in the returned transactions in WEI.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Generate Address Endpoint
api_list.description: The Generate Address endpoint allows you to generate private-public key-pairs along with an associated public address. No information is required with this POST request.

api_list.name: Transaction Hash Endpoint
api_list.description: The Transaction Hash Endpoint returns detailed information about a given transaction based on its hash.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Transaction Index Endpoint by index, limit, block number
api_list.description: The Transaction Index Endpoint by Index, Limit and Block Number returns detailed information about transactions for the block height defined, starting from the index defined up to the limit defined . In the example above index is 0 and limit is 4, therefore the response will be an array of 4 transactions starting from index 0. The highest number for the limit is 50.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Transaction Index Endpoint by Block hash
api_list.description: The Transaction Index Endpoint by Block Hash returns detailed information about a given transaction based on its index and block hash.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet New Transaction Endpoint by keystore
api_list.description: In order to use this endpoint you should have an account(keystore file) stored on our servers.  Then, you need to provide the from address, to address, value to transfer (in Ether), gas price and gas limit in wei. A standard ETH transfer requires at least a gas limit of 21,000 units of gas. Even if you set a higher than the required gas limit, only the required limit will be deducted. Optional fields are: nonce and data. The nonce represents the transactions count for the specified from address. If not specified the system will automatically calculate the correct nonce.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Locally Sign Your Transaction Endpoint
api_list.description: Crypto APIs provides the opportunity to locally sign your transaction. If you want to use third-pary tools for signing your raw transactions you can send to the Locally Sign Your Transaction Endpoint only the following data:  from address; to address; value.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Push Raw Transaction Endpoint
api_list.description: Once you’ve finished signing the raw transaction locally, send that raw transaction to our Push Raw Transaction Endpoint.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Estimate Transaction Gas Endpoint
api_list.description: Crypto APIs provides an endpoint for estimating the gas needed for a successful transaction. This is very useful when sending ether to contracts or making a transaction with additional data in it.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Pending Transactions Endpoint
api_list.description: Pending Transactions Endpoint makes a call to the EVM and returns all pending transactions. The response might be limited if you lack credits.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Queued Transactions Endpoint
api_list.description: Queued Transactions Endpoint makes a call to the EVM and returns all queued transactions. The response might be limited if you lack credits.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Transactions Fee Endpoint
api_list.description: Transactions Fee Endpoint gives information about the gas price for the successfull transactions included in the last 1500 blocks. min shows the lowest gas price, max is the highest and average - the average gas price. recommended is the gas price that we consider as the one that corresponds to a cheap and fast execution. However, it is only a suggestion and should be used at users' sole discretion. All gas prices are in Gwei.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Estimate Gas Smart Contract Endpoint
api_list.description: This endpoint retuns the average gas price and gas limit set by the Ethereum Blockchain. At this point for all kinds of deployments the json result will be as follows:

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Deploy Smart Contract Endpoint
api_list.description: The Deploy Smart Contract Endpoint allows you to push your smart contract to the Ethereum Blockchain. You have to provide the bytecode - compiled to binary solidity code.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Get Token Balance
api_list.description: In the request url you should provide the address you want to observe and the contract address that created the token. After sending the request you will receive a json object with the name of the token, the amount and its symbol.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Transfer Tokens
api_list.description: In order to transfer tokens from one address to another you should provide the from address, the private key or password (if it is an account stored on our servers), the to address, the contract adress that created the tokens and the amount of tokens you would like to transfer. It is also necessary to provide gas price and gas limit. By default these are set to: 21000000000 wei and 60000 wei, accordingly. The amount of token is per unit, for example: if you want to send 120 tokens you should specify:

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Get Address Token Transfers
api_list.description: In the request url you should provide the address you want to observe. The response will be a json object with a list of all token transactions for the specified address (in DESC order).

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Token Transactions By Address
api_list.description: In the request url you should provide the address you want to observe. After sending the request you will receive a json object with a list of each transfer for the specified address that includes the following infromation: the contract, the name, symbol and type of the token.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Create Payment Forwarding
api_list.description: If you have a keystore file/account create on our servers you need to provide the following information: - from address - to address, - callback, - password, - confirmations - after how many confirmations to execute the payment forwarding - gasPrice (Optional) - gasLimit (Optional)

api_list.description: Ethereum Mainnet Create Webhook Endpoint Unconfirmed tx

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Create Webhook Endpoint Confirmed tx
api_list.description: Triggered for every new transaction making it into a new block; in other words, for every first transaction confirmation. This is equivalent to listening to the new-block event and fetching each transaction (or filtered transaction) in the new Block. The payload is a confirmed TX.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Create Webhook Endpoint New Block
api_list.description: Triggered for every new block. The payload is a Block.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Create Webhook Endpoint Address
api_list.description: Simplifies listening to confirmations on all transactions for a given address up to a provided threshold. The payload is a TX. If the transaction is not mined and is in the pending queue a webhook will be sent as well

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Create Webhook Endpoint Token
api_list.description: Simplifies listening to confirmations on all token transfers for a given address up to a provided threshold. The payload is a json object with the token transfer information.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Create Webhook Endpoint TxPool
api_list.description: Similar to ADDRESS Webhook, differes in that it is for a given address found in the transactions in the txpool of the Ethereum Blockchain. The payload is a list with transactions from the txpool for the particular address.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet List Webhook Endpoint
api_list.description: List WebHook Endpoint provides a list with the webhooks for a given user id.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Delete Webhook Endpoint
api_list.description: If you want to delete a webhook just specify the id of the webhook (the one that was returned in the JSON when creating the webhook) in the url request.

api_list.name: Bitcoin Testnet New Transaction Using HDWallet Endpoint
api_list.description: New Transaction Using HDWallet Endpoint provides the possibility to create, sign and send new transactions using your HDWallet. The mandatory fields are: walletName, password, outputs and fee (see example). There are a few optional fields, such as: inputs, fee address and locktime. If input addresses are not included, then the system will automatically choose addresses from the wallet. However, if included, a list of addresses from the wallet and the values should be specified. Fee address is optional and if is specified the fee will be proportionally distributed among the input addresses. Locktime is an integer and has a default value of zero. Use locktime if a transaction should be delayed to a specific time.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet New Transaction Endpoint by keystore
api_list.description: In order to use this endpoint you should have an account(keystore file) stored on our servers.  Then, you need to provide the from address, to address, value to transfer (in Ether), gas price and gas limit in wei. A standard ETH transfer requires at least a gas limit of 21,000 units of gas. Even if you set a higher than the required gas limit, only the required limit will be deducted. Optional fields are: nonce and data. The nonce represents the transactions count for the specified from address. If not specified the system will automatically calculate the correct nonce.

api_list.name: Ethereum Mainnet Generate Account Endpoint
api_list.description: The Generate Account Endpoint allows you to generate private-public key-pairs along with an associated public address encoded in a keyfile. A password and user id are required with this POST request. Keyfiles are stored in a keystore subdirectory on our servers. The critical component of the keyfile, the account’s private key, is always encrypted, and it is encrypted with the password entered when the account was created.  The user id is needed in order to associate the keyfile with the specific user.

api_list.name: Ethereum Rinkeby Transfer Tokens
api_list.description: In order to transfer tokens from one address to another you should provide the from address, the private key or password (if it is an account stored on our servers), the to address, the contract adress that created the tokens and the amount of tokens you would like to transfer. It is also necessary to provide gas price and gas limit. By default these are set to: 21000000000 wei and 60000 wei, accordingly. The amount of token is per unit, for example: if you want to send 120 tokens you should specify:
